etymologies: Middle English (denoting a precious stone in the New Testament): from Old French crisopace, via Latin from Greek khrusoprasos, from khrusos ‘gold’ + prason ‘leek’

definitions: an apple-green variety of chalcedony containing nickel, used as a gemstone.
shortDefinitions: apple-green gemstone consisting of variety of chalcedony that contains nickel

definitions: (in the New Testament) a golden-green precious stone, perhaps a variety of beryl.
shortDefinitions: (in New Testament) golden-green precious stone, perhaps variety of beryl
